Reviews.Title: Good camera, expensive memory card
Reviews.Author: Baileybear
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few ultracompact cameras with a 5x optical zoom.  It is very small with a large (2.5") beautiful LCD screen.  It is also packed with useful features.  I researched many ultracompact cameras and this one came out on top.  The only caveat is that it takes an xD picture card (developed for Olympus and Fuji cameras), which is 3 times more expensive than an sD picture card.  Also beware... some of the features of the camera, such as the panorama function, will not work unless you use an Olympus H type xD picture card, which of course, is the most expensive type of xD card.  It is still a great camera, but it would be nice if somewhere in the official description of the camera, Olympus had included this information!  Some great features:'Available Light' mode for taking indoor photos -- useful when the flash washes out the subject, but the scene is too dark without the flash.'Image Stabilization' for low light photos'Sunset' which brings out the reds and yellows'Fireworks' -- a great option that makes fireworks photos look fantastic'Behind Glass' which reduces the glare and reflection of subjects taken through glass'Documents' which increases contrastSome features that are funky:'Expression Edit'- this takes a photo and changes the expression of the subject, but makes them look more like a cartoon character'Smile Recognition'- when you lock on the subject, the camera takes a photo when the subject smiles (I haven't gotten this one to work yet, but can't imagine using it very often either).The menu system is very easy to use and there is an on camera guide to help you take better photos.The BEST thing about this camera is the in-camera panoramic function!  It is SO cool and easy to do.  I love it.If it wasn't for the xD card, I would rate it 5 stars.  Because of the fact that you are forced to buy the Olympus xD card to get all of the functions to work, I rate it 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: The BEST camera for the $
Reviews.Author: S. WOODS "Collector of ALL Good Things"
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, compact, powerful digital camera. It has 8 megapixels & 5x optical & 5x digital zoom. I did a lot of comparison shopping before purchasing this camera & overall, for the money, this one is the best. It is very easy to use & takes beautifully clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality - Very Disappointed with this camera
Reviews.Author: T. F. Hanna
Reviews.Content: I checked the posted reviews for this camera because it was becoming increasingly apparent that the image quality from my new 820 was poor.  I wanted to see if others were finding the same thing.  Reading the reviews by those customers who are getting poor quality images confirmed my suspicions.  My observations have been identical with those in the reviews.It is possible to take good photographs with this camera, the only problem is that you never know when it is going to happen!  Sometimes they are good and mostly they are bad.  I get a better percentage of good ones outdoors but they aren't all good.  Indoors, forget about it.  The poor quality images are grainy and look like someone drew them with crayons.  A lot of the fine detail is just washed out.The features, menus and large display are great, but the only reason for having a camera is to produce images.  If they are lousy images, who cares about all the great features?  What a disappointment this camera is.I purchased the camera for outdoor activities where the camera could, on rare occasions, get wet.  I wasn't expecting to have to give up on image quality.  If I had it to do over again, I would look at the Canon line of compact cameras because they always seem to take great pictures and the video mode produces .avi files which play on Windows Media Player.  I looked at the Nikons and they all seem to produce .mov video files that require you to install Quicktime on your computer.  If Canon could just make a water resistant, compact camera, I would buy it immediately.

Reviews.Title: Image quality challenged
Reviews.Author: D. Rasor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a couple reasons. 1. Size (it's thinner than my "old" Canon SD700), 2. LCD size (MUCH bigger than the Canon), 3. Zoom (at 5x I was looking forward to better telephoto performance), Lastly, Features (the anti-shake and face tracking seemed like a great idea.Well, I took basics like image quality for granted....big mistake! My first round of shots (using the default-auto settings) were out of focus, grainy (took them indoors with little light so that flash was needed) and basically looked like crap. As an experiment, I took 4 shots with the Olympus and Canon framed exactly the same...both with AUTO settings. The difference was DRAMATIC...Canon looked awesome...every Olympus shot was grainy and poorly focused.I suppose it's possible that I got a bad sample from Olympus; I'm going to try to return it.Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Lauren shopper "Lauren shopper"
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased two of the Olympus Stylus 820 cameras. The first one kept locking up on me.  I would push the shutter button and it would just freeze. The only way to fix it was to remove/insert the battery and it would unlock.  I took that one back and got another one. No problem with this one locking up but a huge problem with the image quality. I bought this camera to replace my older Olympus Stylus 410. I wanted something newer, smaller, faster, etc.  The camera itself is great as far as size, has a great LCD screen, it's fast and easy to use.  However, the image quality is terrible! Shots taken outside look fine.  Constantly all inside shots are dark and grainy.  To experiment I took some identical shots using my old 410 and the new 820. There is a huge noticeable difference in the photos.  The 820 is not only grainy but the colors are off.  The 410  photos came out crystal clear with colors that are true.  I can't recommend the 820.  I am lucky that that I am within my return period and plan to take it back tomorrow and I'll continue to use my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Good, but...
Reviews.Author: N. Grover
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I love the big screen and the photo quality that is consistent in just about any condition. However, I do have a few issues with it. I had the Stylus 710 (until it was stolen...) and replaced it with this one. Although it does have the 8 mega pixels, I just don't think that it would ever utilize that with a large enough print. To accommodate this feature, the camera is considerably bigger.All in all, though, it gets the job done and I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: bad picture quality...
Reviews.Author: Tony Thomas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with great hope. It is sleek and looks great. But it doesn't do what it is made for. The picture quality is bad, esp. pictures taken indoor. Almost all the pictures look grainy. The camera even freezes often. I wanted to return it, but Olympus wouldn't take it back, I even said I'd pay extra for another model, no luck. They made me pay to ship it to them even though it was under warranty. They just cleaned the lens and shipped it back in one day. That didn't solve the problem. I don't want to send it for repair for a second time. I somehow want to get rid of it. I regret the purchase and I'll stay away from Olympus in future. I don't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: High Expectations
Reviews.Content: The Stylus 820 has a short battery life, the inability to turn the power off while connected to the computer to conserve battery life, it locks-up while taking pictures requiring removal of the battery to restart, the images are often blurry even when using a tri-pod, and the cheap plastic battery cover broke the first week and had to be replaced.  Crap! Crap! Crap!

Reviews.Title: Solid Performer
Reviews.Author: C. De Prado "Dad"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife.  She loves it. This is a great camera with easy to use menus and well placed buttons.  It was immediately recognized by my mac running tiger and ilife version 6.  It  would receive a higher rating, but this size camera suffers from too many pixels in too small an optical eye.  It's not that it doesn't take good pictures,  but my 4 year old Canon rebel digital SLR takes better pictures, despite being only a 6 mega-pixel camera.  The reason is that it's optical eye is larger, and therefore captures more light and can better use it's existing sensors to greater effect.  The Olympus squeezes more pixels sensors into a smaller package.  It doesn't produce a better picture,  just one with more noise and artifacts.  This is a criticism of all cameras of this type.  The trade off is that the camera is smaller than an SLR and therefore easier to carry and use. This is why my wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Lobotomy
Reviews.Content: You have to use the auto function to get clear crisp pics.  any other setting turns out blurring.  This camera is very user friendly but not of high quality.  You get was you pay for.  This will work as a party camera but for more professional pics I would go with something else.

Reviews.Title: Image quality issues
Reviews.Author: R. D. Lochhead
Reviews.Content: I have experienced very poor quality images especially indoors with the Stylus 820.  Grainy and washed out images with camera in auto modes. Called tech support and only advice was to do a reset and now I have passed my 2 week period to return it, as it was a Christmas gift.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: C. Castillo
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter in college.....she loves it. Great pics, and excellent zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!!!!
Reviews.Author: Nathan Nieuwsma "Music Buff"
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. I have the Black Stylus 820 and it is not a large camera. In fact I was shocked how little it was compared to its other review. So far I couldn't be happier with it.

Reviews.Title: Please don't purchase this camera
Reviews.Author: JMC
Reviews.Content: I am a huge olympus fan and was looking for a small camera to replace my chunky C-765. The Stylus 820 was given to me as a gift and I've tried to use it, but every photo is blurry.  I've adjusted the settings, I've used the highest quality settings, etc - nothing changes it.  And I'm not shooting professional photos, but when an average group photograph in the middle of the day with no extremes (lighting, colors) and it STILL can't turn out? Its just a bad camera.  Its begun to freeze on me, requiring me to take out the battery and put it back in.  Its too late for me to return it to Olympus, but I'd just strongly discourage anyone from purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Look away!  Do NOT buy this hunk of junk!
Reviews.Author: Keep the Fayth "Keep the Fayth"
Reviews.Content: I take many many pictures and I absolutely HATE this camera.  The only pics that come out barely average are the outside pics.  The inside pics are dark and blurry.  I have messed around with the settings and still cannot get any sort of improvement!  Do NOT buy this camera.  For what I have been readng you want the Fuji Finepix f40fd, the Cannon Powershot SD1000!  I purchased the Fuji and so far LOVE it!  The higher the ISO number, the better.  Good luck!  Happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - fits everywhere & Great quality of pictures
Reviews.Author: Anna "nubika"
Reviews.Content: I recomend this camera!!! If you are looking for little one which can do great job. This is the one. Many different options to play with pictures, very easy and comfortable to use. I am so glad that I purchesed it. Looks great and works perfect. I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Olympus stylus 820
Reviews.Author: A. Sante
Reviews.Content: I love this camerea, I have had the same brand before and it is wonderful and easy to use. Just remember to buy an Olympus xd card for it, it does not come wit the camera.

Reviews.Title: Best 5 x zoom camera on the market.
Reviews.Author: Z. A. Shadbolt "Texas Brit"
Reviews.Content: I have looked at lots of cameras over the past few weeks and this is definitely the best one for value, looks and simplicity.  I wanted something bigger than my current Olypmus 3 x zoom but not bulkier, and this fit the bill without a doubt. With its image stabilisation 8.0 megapixels and 5 x zoom, this small camera had everything i was looking for. So easy to use and very light. For an amateur like me its awesome and fits in your purse without taking up too much room.  Olympus have done it again!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera in a Little Package - Few Problems
Reviews.Content: Not too big, not too small. The Olympus Sytlus is a great buy. I just got it for Christmas and I'm very pleased. I was expecting it to take mediocre pictures, but they're alot better than imagined. The only thing that bothers me with this camera, is the night scene SCN mode. I took a picture during the night, and it came out blurry, but my hands weren't shaking. Other than that, this camera has taken nothing but good pictures.Recap:Good:-Small-Light-Good quality pictures.-Comes in different colors, depending on your taste.-8.0MPBad:-Night pictures aren't nessecarily good.-You have to buy the memory card specially designed for it. (Olympus xD Memory card.)

Reviews.Title: serious image quality concerns
Reviews.Author: chowderboy "chowderboy"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a few days now, and I'm concerned about the image quality. I used to have a Cannon Elph, which I loved. I moved to Olympus because I was sold on the shock/water resist. Also love the feature set of this camera and some of the gimmicks... But so far, the image quality is way lower than my Cannon. I haven't given up yet, but I'm not optimistic that this is camera is going to cut it.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Neal Clayton "Neal C."
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small and easy to use.  One of the features that we like about this camera is the speed of its processing and zoom features.  The camera powers up quickly, zooms in and out quickly and snaps shot after shot with only a very brief pause between photos.  Being 8 megapixel, it takes nice photos.  We also like the large LCD display.  The camera easily fits into a shirt or pant pocket and is very light.  The display is bright, but not as bright as our last camera and thus why we did not give the camera a perfect 5 stars.  Overall we are very pleased with the features and performance especially at the $200 pricepoint.

Reviews.Title: Olympus camera - came quick and is great!
Reviews.Author: Leigh Pittman "Leigh P"
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, lightweight, and takes wonderful pictures.  It does have many functions which require reading the manual, however.  Beyond that, it is user-friendly and its 5x zoom makes it one great little digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty much what I hoped for.
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: This is the same camera I already owned; but accidentally damaged the lens. It was cheaper to buy this used camera, than to repair the old one. It looks and works just like my old one.

Reviews.Title: Great Point-And-Shoot
Reviews.Author: TrippingBilly
Reviews.Content: This camera is not a feature-rich as some of the competitors out there, but it is a great selection for a point-and-shoot. Holds a charge real well, small and easy to transport, large screen, easy to learn and use. Overall, this is a good choice for someone looking for their first point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!!
Reviews.Author: puddles1450
Reviews.Content: I have always had Olympus cameras and had good luck with them.  However, purchasing this one was a huge mistake.  Almost every picture comes out with a fog like appearance.  I've changed the settings and played with it, to no avail.  Do not waste your money!!

Reviews.Title: Mixed bag
Reviews.Author: Billy Bob "project hacker"
Reviews.Content: After using this camera for 3 years as a pocket-able alternative to my digital SLR I'm ready to report on my opinion after replacing it with another brand. On the plus side, the camera is small, the design is good, USB transfer is fast and I like the auto-sensing of the usb connection to the computer, avoiding the needless screen illumination and corresponding battery use during transfer. The battery has been dependable over many cycles and thousands of images. The camera did survive a drop to concrete recently with just small dings.On the negative side, the number one annoyance is slowness to focus out of direct sunlight, frequently allowing out of focus image capture. Focusing by depressing the shutter part way can take time and is not always opportune before depressing fully for capture. The xD memory was not a good storage choice, as it's being phased out now. The printing on the mode dial (camera, playback, etc.) is worn off making correct selection a process of watching what the display does. The lens shutter got gummed up several times, likely due to pocket lint, it always cleared after a while. The power button is too easily pressed, resulting in periodic and inappropriate in clothing or bag lens deployment. The zoom function during video recording is very audible on playback. The image quality in low light situations can be quite grainy and there is no auto-focus during video recording so panning during a shot between foreground and background objects fails to refocus.

Reviews.Title: Great quality, lousy battery door and battery life
Reviews.Author: R. BAK
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about two years, use it frequently in a variety of conditions.  LOVE the camera for it's picture quality, sensible features, looks.  HOWEVER, have repeatedly had problems with batteries dying and becoming unchargeable, which has added up as I have ended up buying and replacing 4 batteries over the time I have owned it.  And now, after 2 years of use, I am finding that the battery door has become a major problem.  First, the curved part of the door broke off for no discernable reason at all other than age, which meant that the batter doesn't stay locked in place.  Replaced the door about 2 months ago and lo and behold the NEW door has now broken in the same place.  I love this camera, but I'm tired of messing with these issues and am in the market for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: A let down after my Canon
Reviews.Author: Bryce
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 18 months ago.  I had been using a Canon 2MP camera for years, but wanted something with higher resolution.  I bought the camera because of its 5x Optical zoom, and good reviews.  However, I found that the battery life was terrible, the image quality so-so, and the battery door plastic broke in my hands after about a year.  I had been very careful with the camera too.I since replaced it with a modern Canon 10mp.  The canon was actually cheaper and is simply a better camera.  Great battery life, better image quality, and overall better construction.

Reviews.Title: Camera is so bad I threw it away!
Reviews.Author: M. BURRIS
Reviews.Content: I love my new Canon so much that I literally took this Stylus 820 and threw it in the trash!  It was in excellent condition BUT it couldn't take a clear picture to save its own life!  So rather than give or sell it to someone else I just took it straight to the trash so no one else would have to go through the pain that it has caused me.I wasted over a year of my daughters life capturing some great moments... too bad they were blurry, grainy, spotted, etc...  There are NO settings or features to help this camera!  I have tried everything.  I could go on and on but seeing as nearly every review of this camera says this exact same thing I will just save my time.  I happily upgraded to a DSLR, Canon Rebel T1i,  Im so happy!  And yes I realize its a huge upgrade and its unfair to compare a DSLR to a point and shoot, so to put it out there... I would recommend a disposable camera before this Stylus 820.  All I know is that I am done capturing perfect moments only to see them all blurred out on my computer and prints.Please trust me on this review, I take reviews very seriously and if there had been reviews like mine out there when I purchased this camera it could have saved me the misery...  I cannot believe Olympus backs this camera they should be ashamed their name is on it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: K. Tutor "techno geek"
Reviews.Content: The only flaw that I have with the camera is the labeling on the turn wheel.  It has worn off and I cannot tell when I turn it, where I am turning.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves this cameral.
Reviews.Author: Lisa "mountaineer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter a year ago and never got around to doing a review.  She loves. it.

Reviews.Title: Very Good, BUT...
Reviews.Author: A. M. Gomez "Gomez"
Reviews.Content: Good camera. But the one thing I hate is that it brings A LOT of noise to most of the pictures. Even when I adjust the ISO... it's annoying sometimes.

Reviews.Title: If there were a -0 star I would use it
Reviews.Author: L. Mehtlan
Reviews.Content: Ugh..This camera SUCKS.  You cannot take a good photo with this camera AT ALL.  Well, you can but it has to be outside in perfect light in macro mode.  That's it.  If you enjoy close up outdoor photos of a ladybug on a leaf, this is your camera.  I can't tell you how many perfect shots I have missed using this camera.  Every single shot comes out grainy, dark, unfocused and looks like you took the picture underwater.  Don't even get me started with trying to shoot indoors or in the dark.  Not even auto mode produces a decent picture.  Whatever you do DO NOT buy this camera.  I wish I would have found these reviews before buying this useless waste of tin.

Reviews.Title: NOT impressed - falls way short of my expecations
Reviews.Author: bajanshopper "Timzagain"
Reviews.Content: My husband got me this for Christmas last year.  Unlike my husband, I'm NOT a photography buff, but I wanted a small easy to use point-and-shoot camera!  This camera was bought based on our experience with Olympus, particularly our daughter's Stylus 760!  I liked the 760, and thought it would have been more than adequate for my needs;  husband decided to "upgrade" to the Stylus 820!I love the size of the camera - I can easily slip it into my handbag without it being a nuisance.  That's probably the best thing I can say about it.The outdoor shots with this camera have been merely OK, not great but the indoor shots/ night time shots are terrible!We've been so disgusted that my husband has considered passing on this camera to our 10 year old, and buying me another camera of another brand, probably Canon.Did I mention that the Olympus neoprene case recommended on Amazon, for this camera, actually fits very badly?  I switched to a no-name case that fits nicely, takes up a lot less space in my bag and cost me half what I paid for the Olympus case!Based on my experience, I am not tempted to buy Olympus again!

Reviews.Title: The Olympus 820 is crap - do not buy this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Frank S. Urban "Slim"
Reviews.Content: For 20 years I've been a user of the Olympus Stylus cameras first film and then a Stylus 410 (took on the appalachin Trail for 2100 miles).  They were great!  However beware!! This 820 is trash.  Very, very poor quality pictures, even during the day.  This company needs to repay folks for their purchase.  They should not get away with putting out a product like this.  There are too many folks that have the same poor quality that I have.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: AS
Reviews.Content: this camera is amazing. can do anything with it, all sorts of lighting(including back lighting!!!), can stop movement(never get a blurry shot), and every photo comes out crystal clear. BUY this camera...you won't find better at this size and price

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera Purchase
Reviews.Author: Esther Austin
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Olympus Camera for a Christmas present surpise for my son.  It is GREAT and arrived in a timely manner!  I was thrilled to receive it in time for Christmas for him.  The only issue I had was that the memory card that I purchased separately from another individual got lost in the holiday mail and did not arrive until after New Year's.  As always, I have great luck with my orders from Amazon!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift. I was highly disappointed when I had to return it because of poor image quality. The features available on this camera sounded fantastic, but I couldn't use them because 1 in 5 of my pictures was blury or out of focus. At 8 megapixels and a 5X optical zoom I should have had super clear pictures. I have owned 2 other Olympus cameras and have loved them, but I wanted something smaller. I was very disappointed to have to return this one. I exchanged it with a Canon Powershot and I love it!

Reviews.Title: olympus 820 camera
Reviews.Author: S. Fair
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for Christmas.  Powers up fast! View screen is bright, big and easy to read.  Controls seem easy to understand. We have the Sony Cypershot and Canon ELF cameras also and the Olympus quickly became the family favorite with the Sony a close second.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the camera.
Reviews.Author: old mx rider
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  Perfect for my needs. This is the 3rd Olympus camera I have owned.  I consider myself a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is the coolest
Reviews.Author: Franklin P. Boyd
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend and she LOVES it.  I had a chance to play with it several times and it has so many cool features that I didnt even know about.  The view screen is large and easy to see.  Pictures come out great.  And the thing is waterproof to boot!  I looked at several cameras at Best Buy and this one was thinner than most with a bigger screen.  I bought it here on amazon because they are always cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: April Jimenez
Reviews.Content: It was sent within 2 days in perfect condition.  I am now looking to order more electronics from this company, I am very pleased with them.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Grossmeier "C. Grossmeier"
Reviews.Content: I had hoped for better.  Even at its best quality, each image looks like it was shot in a snow storm.  The noise is extreme and the compression destroys the rest of the image.  If you are looking to shoot sharp, colorful, and print quality images from this camera, consider something else!

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
5x optical zoom; Face Detection technology
2.7-inch HyperCrystal LCD; Bright Capture technology for low-light photos
All-weather body with seals and gaskets to protect from rain, snow, or sand
Powered by one Li-Ion rechargeable battery (battery and charger included); stores images on xD Picture Cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus Stylus 820 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)
